intro: Osmorhiza aristata var. laxa, commonly known as the slender sweetroot, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. The leaves are lanceolate and have a distinctive, fragrant scent when crushed.
